wikitext.*:
'''Ruamórë''' was the dwelling of [[Ungweliantë]],<ref group="note">The name for the character was either '''''Ungwë-Tuita''''' or '''''Ungwë Fuiva''''' in the texts in which the name ''Ruamórë'' appears.</ref> according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref name="Par">{{PE|12}}, pp. 80-1</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Ruamórë'' is in [[Qenya]]. It is glossed as "Still Night" by ''[[Eldamo]]'', consisting of ''[[rua]]'' ("steady, still, tranquil") + ''[[mórë]]'' ("night, darkness; black, dark").<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3919909169.html|articlename=ᴱQ. ''Ruamóre'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=11 April 2022}}</ref>

However, in a note to an entry in the ''[[Qenya Lexicon]]'', the first element of the name comes from either ''[[rú (Qenya word)|rú]]'' (1. "dwelling, village"; 2. "steadfastness") or ''[[ruella]]'' ("hamlet").<ref name="Par"/>
